pages.text: Some instruments in MIMI are larger and must be placed into the world as a block before they can be played.$(br2)Note that only one player can be seated at a block instrument at a time.

pages.title: Opening the GUI
pages.text: To play an open block instrument first right-click on it while not holding another instrument to seat yourself at it and then right-click it again to open the $(l:instruments_gui)Instrument GUI$(/l).$(br2)To leave a block instrument use the same keybind that you would use to dismount a horse or boat.

pages.title: Playing without the GUI
pages.text: Block instruments can also be played without the GUI being open by setting a MIDI Input on the instrument. Note that you must still be seated at the block instrument to play it using a MIDI Input.

pages.title: Setting the Maestro
pages.text: Since you cannot use a block instrument on a player to set them as the $(l:band_maestro)maestro$(/l) like you can for a hand-held instrument you can set the maestro in another way.$(br2)By right-clicking on a block instrument while holding a hand-held instrument you will copy the linked maestro from the hand-held instrument into the block instrument (if one is set).
